contentList.content: For longer than you can remember, you have traversed the Astral Sea. There, you experienced firsthand the wonders of the Silver Void: you stopped aging. In your travels, you have camped on the petrified hulks of dead gods and you crossed paths with a wandering deity.

In the Astral Sea, you crossed paths with a wandering deity. The encounter was brief and nonviolent, yet it made a lasting impression on you. This deity saw fit to share one secret or obscure bit of cosmic lore with you.

In the Astral Sea, you crossed paths with a wandering deity. The encounter was brief and nonviolent, yet it made a lasting impression on you. This deity saw fit to share one secret or obscure bit of cosmic lore with you.
You have a permanent advantage on Wisdom saving throws.
You have a permanent advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

You were raised in the void of Wildspace, home to asteroid miners, moon farmers, and other hardy folk. You spent your early years on the crew of a spelljamming ship, performing helpful chores such as swabbing the deck, loading and offloading cargo, and scraping barnacles off the hull.
You have gained experience from your time in space and have learned to adapt to any gravity.
You have gained experience from your time in space and have learned to adapt to any gravity.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1 for every level you have gained.
Your hit point maximum increases by 1 for every level you have gained.
Unlock and read the Book of Dead Gods.
Learn local history from the druidic frescos.
Discover the strange nature of the Thayan tome.
Finish reading the Thayan tome of necromancy.
Read the arachnomancer's journals at the bottom of the well.
Disable an arcane turret using a sussur flower.
Read Omeluum's notes on illithid magic.
Read the obscure text by a drow matron.
Solve the moon puzzle sealing the door to the Underdark.
Recognise the druid and Harper armour.
Discover the secrets of the Adamantine Forge from all three drow wizards.
Figure out Akabi's scheme and obtain the 'grand' prize.
Let yourself be scanned by a Steel Watcher.
Take up Valeria's serial killer investigation.
Get a fresh perspective on your relationship with a companion.
Meet Gortash in Wyrm's Rock and witness his coronation.
Uncover the machinery powering the printing press.
Found out how Araj's blood experiments are going.
Ask to join the Society of Brilliance.
Discover the undying sentinel underneath Wyrm's Crossing.
Obtain access to the House of Hope portal.
Behold the true Captain Grisly in all her piratical glory.
Find and use the Torch of Revocation.
Craft Nettie's antidote in the cauldron.
Restore power to the elevator in the Arcane Tower.
Create a masterwork item from sussur bark.
Rescue Oskar the painter from the Zhentarim.
Repair the elevator in the Zhentarim hideout.
Drink one of Auntie Ethel's unique potions.
Identify the drow armour near Waukeen's Rest.
Evaluate the ruins in Grymforge and share your findings with the duergar mason.
Observe the effects of the Chest of the Mundane.
Craft something in the Adamantine Forge.
Trust and a Little Pixie Dust
Investigate the Moonlantern and find its power source.
Fill all sockets with Sharran gems in the Gauntlet of Shar.
Discover the fate of the mason.
Witness a horrid operation in the cursed house of healing.
Drink at least 1 of the brewer's steins.
Acquire a magical item from the toll collector's confiscation chest.
Unlock and take the Spear of Rampant Night.
In the Palm of My Hand
Acquire the Brilliant Retort from Barcus.
Obtain a piece of infernal equipment from Dammon.
Discover the source of the displacer beast's infatuation.
Blood, Sweat, and the Other Thing
Give your blood to Araj Oblodra.
Piece the corpse of Dribbles back together.
Describe your perfect weapon to Gyldro Angleiron.
Partake in the lurid services of Sharess' Caress.
Return the Sentient Amulet to Shirra.
Use the runepowder bomb to destroy the Steel Watch Foundry.
Discover the inner workings of the Baldur's Mouth printing press.
Find out what happened to Araj and her blood experiment.
Open any of the special vaults in the Counting House.
Acquire an exquisite new outfit from Figaro's.
Correctly identify all of the Devil's Fee's relics.
Burn Oskar's painting with a Torch of Revocation.
Find and read the dead druid's journal about how the shadow curse came to be.
Discover the fate of Ketheric's family members.
Discover the source of Ketheric's shame.
Open the way into the Sharran Sanctuary.
Perform the ritual in the Sharran Sanctuary.
Discover the truth behind the numerous rats in the Gauntlet of Shar.
Open the way into the Gauntlet of Shar.
Help Mol win the game of lanceboard.
Wake Art from his catatonic slumber.
A Little Too Familiar with the Grotesque...
Solve Balthazar's secret study puzzle without making a mistake.
Successfully complete the mind puzzle in the mind flayer colony.
*Use your innate powers to tame the Helm*
*A strange device, it seems to allow you to improve your ship with technologies and weapons that you discover*
*Channels the arcane flow of the Helm*
*Try to understand the magic emanating from the Helm*
*Your mind does not seem to reach the arcana of the Helm*
*You are successfully syncing with the Helm*
*Call upon the whispers of your past to guide your will*
*The energy emanating from the Helm seems familiar to someone like you*
*The energy emanating from the Helm seems familiar to someone like you*
*Travel to the nearest city 'The Lower Rock'*
*The Helm allows you to naturally navigate to the nearest village in the Astral Sea. Enjoy the journey.*
*The Helm allows you to naturally navigate through the Astral Sea to your next destination.*
*The Helm allows you to naturally navigate through the Astral Sea to your next destination.*
*The Helm allows you to naturally navigate through the Astral Sea to your next destination.*
*The Helm allows you to naturally navigate through the Astral Sea to your next exploration.*
*Perform a ritual to synchronize with the Helm*
*A simple merchant who offers goods for purchase*
Think the stardust vendor will be in soon?
In the Astral Sea, one moment you're adrift, the next you're face-to-face with a god.
Haven't aged a day since I left my world. Strange feeling, that.
Nothing like the hum of the silver void to ease the mind.
Keep your wits here stranger, the stars might swallow you whole.
Watch your step around those Githyanki pirates, unless you like the taste of steel.
Floating islands again today... they're closer than they were yesterday.
And if you gaze for long into a star, the star gazes also into you.
*This blacksmith seems to have goods to sell*
The forge never sleeps, and neither do I, it seems.
I swear, one day, I'll forge a hammer that doesn't weigh half a mountain.
Master Thomas says it's the heat that toughens you... feels like it's cooking me alive.
Master Thomas says it's 'precision work.' Looks a lot like hard labor to me.
One day, I'll have my own forge, and maybe I'll get an apprentice to do all this.
Last time I drifted in space, a voice called my name from beyond the stars.
Time's a funny thing here; best not to think too hard about it.
I swear I saw a god drift by, wrapped in chains, looking right through me.
Here's to another day the Astral Sea didn't claim us! Bottoms up!
First time here, eh? You'll find no better ale, nor stranger folk.
A toast! May the stars never turn their gaze our way.
So there I was, wrestling a megapede with one hand and holding my drink in the other!
The stars watch us, so we watch each other. Keep your allies close, friend.
Drink up, mate! In the Astral Sea, you never know when you'll float by this way again.
Ever seen a mind flayer ship up close?
The stars tell stories, if you know how to listen.
Mind your thoughts, traveler. They drift louder out here.
Hold tight to your soul, stranger. The void has ways of taking what it wants.
A gith raider once told me, 'Here, time's just another horizon.'
Keep an eye out for fallen starssome hold secrets from other worlds.
Floating islands come and go. Like dreams, they vanish if you don't catch them.
I swear the stars look closer after a few rounds of beer!
Cheers to our last port; may the next be as lively as this one!
Never trust a sailor without a tale or two of ghost ships.
I heard a tale of a star you can drink from… don't know what's true anymore.
I've seen ships come back empty-handed, as if the crew just… dissolved into the stars.
You can find lost memories floating in the Astral Sea… but not all of them are yours to take.
Touching a star isn't the hard part. Surviving what comes after, now that's a challenge.
I once found a scroll just floating in space, but it vanished before I could grab it.
You ever notice how you can taste the sky in these drinks? It's like a piece of infinity.
Bought a map from a gith traderbest gold I ever spent. Took me to worlds I never knew existed.
Every drink here tastes like dreams and memories. Or maybe that's just the stardust.
Just another round to keep us steady in this strange, spinning universe.
It's funnyout here, a single night can feel like a whole lifetime.
They say Spelljamming Helm knows your soul better than you do. A toast to our guides, then!
Raise a glass! Even out here, we're closer than family.
A ship passed by yesterday, all painted in strange colors. Said they'd seen the stars at the 'edge.' I wonder what that means…
The stars don't rest, so why should we?
I used to look up at the stars and think I'd never see them up close. Now? They're more like neighbors.
We say we 'sail' the astral, but some days, I feel more like I'm floating in a memory that isn't mine.
They say the Astral is timeless, but my joints sure feel it. Each cycle feels longer than the last.
There's something soothing about the silence here, once you get used to it. But every now and then, it sounds like whispers.
Keep your weapons close, if you've got the nerve to use them.
I've met phantoms in the Astral Sea with more spine than your crew.
Tell me, do you fight, or do you just scream? I'm fine with either.
Astral raiders fear no void, can you say the same, wretch?
Touch me again, and you'll lose that hand.
If you're going to linger, at least try not to bore me.
Did I invite you this close? Didn't think so.
Stay back, unless you want me to make a quick end of this.
The more you stare, the less I like you.
Is there a purpose to your presence, or just an itch for trouble?
Flexible in form, firm in resolve.
Not every adventurer can be as... versatile as me.
I don't talk to boring people.
Say what you will about the Astral Sea, but no place has better night markets.
One day I'll retire to a nice quiet nebula.
Navigating the Astral Sea isn't easy, but the treasures make it worth the journey.
If you see a comet trader offering "good fortune", you'll want to check for curses first.
Know any good spots for an honest night's sleep?
All those lives, running from star to star, never finding peace.
There's more wisdom in one quiet moment than in a thousand words.
In the depths of space, I found peace.
I've seen worlds come and go.
Lash out with mandibles to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyze</LSTag> your target.
Lash out with mandibles to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PARALYZED">Paralyze</LSTag> your target.
We'll rebuild a god with your bones!
Their fragments will live through us!
The corpses of gods hold more promise than any Elder Brain!
We don't need the Grand Design. The old gods' power is ours to claim.
Why follow an ancient mind when we can create something greater?
It appears that you now have ownership of a Spelljamming Ship in the Astral Plane. You can now explore the Astral Plane with your Space Galleon.
The hold of your ship allows you to rest peacefully.
It looks like you can upgrade your ship with equipment.
Your ship is now equipped with a Ballistae that you can use against your enemies.
Your ship is now equipped with a Cannon that you can use against your enemies.
Exploring the Astral Sea with your ship is not without danger!
The Lower Rock appears to be a small trading town, a supply point for space travelers.
A cultist? It clashes with the overall atmosphere of Lower rock.
It's time to explore this Spacecrafter Inn.
Some ghosts and a strange cultist. What does that mean?
Explore the old Sanctum lost in space.
Were they trying to create their own god?
Experiments with corpses, dead people, illithids. It doesn't seem very clear.
It's time to move forward into Baldur's Gate.
Use your Ship's Magica to bombard once on 2 areas.
Use your Ship's Magica to bombard once on 2 areas.
Use your Ship's Magica to bombard once on 2 areas.
Use your Ship's Cannon to bombard 5 times an area.
Use your Ship's Ballistae to shoot once an area.
You own a Spelljamming Ship in the Astral Sea.
You cannot sync with a non-existing Helm or Space Ship.
Transfer the Spelljamming Attunement to an ally.
Allows you to use your Ship's Equipments from the ground.
Allows you to use your Ship's Equipment remotely.
However, you need to own a Spelljamming Ship and have it equipped with an Equipment. Otherwise the spell will be of no use.
You must resynchronize with your Spelljamming Helm to reuse its weapons.
A title deed from the Astral Plane
An old, forgotten title deed for an old space vessel.
An old, forgotten title deed from the Astral Plane for an old space vessel.
Allows you to claim a Spelljamming Ship.
This ship is a mainstay among the host of vessels that ply Wildspace and the Astral Sea. A Space Galleon can easily pass for an ordinary seafaring galleon.
First, you need to manually activate the purchase order. Second, you will be able to install your Ballistae via the Ship's upgrade device.
A purchase order for a Spelljamming weapon.
First, you need to manually activate the purchase order. Second, you will be able to install your Cannon via the Ship's upgrade device.
A purchase order for a Spelljamming weapon.
You can install a Ballistae via the upgrade device.
You can install a Cannon via the upgrade device.
This place lacks air. An air bubble can counter this harmful effect.
This place is magically filled with air to breathe.
Scroll of Summon Giant Space Hamster
Summon a brave 'Giant Space Hamster'. He temporarily adds himself to your team.
Head covered with an air bubble filled with fresh air.
Head covered with an air bubble filled with fresh air.
You create a spectral globe around the head of a willing creature you can see within range. The globe is filled with fresh air that lasts until the spell ends.
This trinket allows you to create a spectral globe around the head of 3 willing creatures you can see within range. The globe is filled with fresh air that lasts until the spell ends.
A bulky helmet, which fully encases your head.
Gives the "Air Bubble" effect and resistance to "Acid" clouds.
You sync with the Helm of your Ship, allowing you to use your Ship's Equipments from the ground.
You sync with the Helm of your Ship, allowing you to use your Ship's Equipments from the ground.
Allows you to use your Ship's Equipments from the ground.

Within a Wildspace system, this portable arcane device once automatically tracked the positions and movements of all suns, planets, moons, and comets within that system, projecting a display of these bodies into the space above its current location. In that display, a white, pulsating pinprick of light marked the orrery’s location.
You have a Proficienty bonus in Nature and Perception.
You have a Proficienty bonus in Nature and Perception.

A Reigar master craftsman created this piece of jewelry in the form of a ring to put on your finger. The magic contained in this item has been perfected and the object therefore automatically attunes to its wearer.

A Reigar master craftsman created this piece of jewelry in the form of bracelets to put on your hands. The magic contained in this item has been perfected and the object therefore automatically attunes to its wearer.

A Reigar master craftsman created this piece of jewelry in the form of a diadem to put on your head. The magic contained in this item has been perfected and the object therefore automatically attunes to its wearer.

A Reigar master craftsman created this piece of jewelry in the form of an amulet to put on your neck. The magic contained in this item has been perfected and the object therefore automatically attunes to its wearer.
The wearer's weapon attacks deal an additional [1] force damage.
The wearer's weapon attacks deal an additional [1] force damage.
The wearer's weapon attacks deal an additional [1] force damage.
Summon duplicates that looks just like the caster.
Summon duplicates that looks just like the caster.
Having this item in inventory grants you its magical effect.
You have a Proficienty bonus in Nature and Perception.
A trinket made by a Chwinga. Once used, this charm goes away.
A trinket made by a Chwinga. Once used, this charm goes away.
This trinket allows you to magically create 3 Thieves' Tools for your adventure.
Clown shoes that squeak when you walk.
You get a Stealth and Survival penalty when you equip this item.
An exotic weapon invented by the Thri-kreen.
An exotic weapon invented by the Thri-kreen.
An exotic weapon invented by the Thri-kreen.
